messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1558
messages.msgSnippet: All pure unadulterated bs.  Nancy said she couldn t believe the stories that girl comes up with.  Everyone said she came by her talents naturally
messages.messageBody:
All pure unadulterated bs. Nancy said she couldn't believe the stories
"that girl comes up with." Everyone said she came by her talents naturally
(newspapers, etc.) and she bombed out pamphlet copy in minutes that would
take other folks days, weeks or even months to come up with.

One of her comments during one of her People's Park speaches was "rape
sells," so none of us took too much notice of her accusations.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: Wendy Silver <wew99@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, November 01, 2001 2:37 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1558


> >Not that it really matters, but this wasn't my comment:
>
> > "This is not how I remember the case. I remember watching a number of
> > > shows
> > > > with my Dad where she was portrayed as a rebellious, deliquent,
> spoiled,
> > > > rich, white kid."
> Wendy
> PS
> I think that I am too lazy and don't care enough to do more research on
the
> subject, but my image of Patty has changed. I never questioned if she was
a
> victim. I just always thought it was awful that no one pardoned her before
> Clinton. So you really think she made up all of the rape and closet
stories?
> Those stories seemed like something only a real victim could tell.
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1558
messages.msgSnippet: ... spoiled, ... Wendy PS I think that I am too lazy and don t care enough to do more research on the subject, but my image of Patty has changed. I never
messages.messageBody:
>Not that it really matters, but this wasn't my comment:

> "This is not how I remember the case. I remember watching a number of
> > shows
> > > with my Dad where she was portrayed as a rebellious, deliquent,
spoiled,
> > > rich, white kid."
Wendy
PS
I think that I am too lazy and don't care enough to do more research on the
subject, but my image of Patty has changed. I never questioned if she was a
victim. I just always thought it was awful that no one pardoned her before
Clinton. So you really think she made up all of the rape and closet stories?
Those stories seemed like something only a real victim could tell.
